CN.content:
Please identify the "Material Name" entities in the following paragraph.

Paragraph: 8 and our group 9 independently reported PCDTBT - based ladder - type polymers with forced planarity of which device performance showed impressive PCEs of up to 4.59% with reduced bandgap ( ca.

Let's think step by step.
1. PCDTBT: This is a material name. It stands for Poly(3,4-di(thiophene-2-yl)-thieno[3,2-b]thiophene): a type of conducting polymer.
Please remove irrelevant entities and only keep the entities that clearly refer to Material Name.
1. PCDTBT: This is a material name. It stands for Poly(3,4-di(thiophene-2-yl)-thieno[3,2-b]thiophene): a type of conducting polymer.

Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Material Name".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

PN.content:
Please identify the "Property Name" entities in the following paragraph.

Paragraph: 8 and our group 9 independently reported PCDTBT - based ladder - type polymers with forced planarity of which device performance showed impressive PCEs of up to 4.59% with reduced bandgap ( ca.

Let's think step by step.

1. PCDTBT: This is a specific type of polymer, so it can be considered a Property Name entity representing the material used in the research.
2. ladder-type polymers: This is a type of polymer structure, so it can be considered a Property Name entity representing the shape or configuration of the polymers.
3. forced planarity: This is a property or characteristic of the polymers, so it can be considered a Property Name entity representing the way the polymers are arranged or structured.
4. device performance: This is a property or characteristic of the device made from the polymers, so it can be considered a Property Name entity representing the efficiency or effectiveness of the device.
5. PCEs: This stands for Power Conversion Efficiencies, which is a property or characteristic of the device, so it can be considered a Property Name entity representing the ability of the device to convert energy into usable power.
6. reduced bandgap: This is a property or characteristic of the polymers, so it can be considered a Property Name entity representing the energy difference between the valence and conduction bands in the material.
Please remove irrelevant entities and only keep the entities that clearly refer to Material Property.

1. PCDTBT: This is a specific type of polymer, which can be considered a Material Property entity representing the material used in the research.
2. reduced bandgap: This is a property or characteristic of the polymers, so it can be considered a Material Property entity representing the energy difference between the valence and conduction bands in the material.

Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Property Name".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

| Property Name |
| --- |
| PCDTBT (type of polymer) |
| reduced bandgap (property of polymers) |

PV.content:
Please identify the "Property Value" entities in the following paragraph.

Paragraph: 8 and our group 9 independently reported PCDTBT - based ladder - type polymers with forced planarity of which device performance showed impressive PCEs of up to 4.59% with reduced bandgap ( ca.

Let's think step by step.

1. PCDTBT: This is a specific type of polymer, so it can be considered a Property Value entity representing the material or substance used in the creation of the ladder-type polymers.
2. 4.59%: This is the Percentage Efficiency (PCE) of the device, which is a measure of the device's performance. It can be considered a Property Value entity representing the output or result of the research.
3. ca. (approximately): This is a qualifier indicating an approximation, so it doesn't directly represent a Property Value entity. However, the value it modifies, which is not explicitly stated in the paragraph, could be a Property Value entity such as the reduced bandgap.
4. reduced bandgap: This is a Property Value entity representing the narrower energy gap between the conduction and valence bands in the PCDTBT-based polymers.
Please remove irrelevant entities and only keep the entities that clearly refer to Value of Material Property.

1. PCDTBT: This is a specific type of polymer, which can be considered a Property Value entity representing the material or substance used in the creation of the ladder-type polymers.
2. 4.59%: This is the Percentage Efficiency (PCE) of the device, which is a measure of the device's performance, and can be considered a Property Value entity representing the output or result of the research.
3. reduced bandgap: This is a Property Value entity representing the narrower energy gap between the conduction and valence bands in the PCDTBT-based polymers.

Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Property Value".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

| Property Value |
| --- |
| PCDTBT-based ladder-type polymers |
| PCE of up to 4.59% |
| reduced bandgap (approximately) |
| ca. reduced bandgap (approximately narrower energy gap) |

Note: Since the exact value of the reduced bandgap is not explicitly stated in the paragraph, it is included as an approximation with the qualifier "ca.". Therefore, it is listed as two separate Property Value entities for clarity. However, in reality, they represent the same property with different levels of precision.
